content: Has perf been acting up recently? Results for #92889 , a small change in the uncoditional recursion lint, show new invocations of the codegen_fulfill_obligation query. No idea how #92889 could cause that, but anything's possible I guess. I thought I would check here first.
I don't think we have results yet for the next master commit
(or a next master commit, for that matter)

That looks like an extra cost of Instance::resolve in is_recursive_call. Previously we almost immediately found counter examples to a self-recursion, but this isn't the case any longer. Will see in a bit if #93381 helps there.
It did help in case of projection-caching check full.

That's clever. #93381 seems to have fixed it entirely. It's a bit funny that we rely on callees having different arity from the caller to go fast. Oh well.

Here's the cumulative effect for whoever's doing triage this week.

https://perf.rust-lang.org/compare.html?start=563250a65c884c6767dc2ee2e2580360d33d561c&end=c8a909af71d1fc4059328c1f9f91b03e269f85e8
